Which concentration term is defined as t: In the Hall Heroult process for the extraction of aluminium why is the metal extracted by electrolysis rather than carbon reduction

Molality is a measure of concentration t: In a crystal field, the d orbitals split into different energy levels. When white light falls on the complex, electrons absorb specific wavelengths to jump from the lower energy d orbital to the higher one (d d transition). The transmitted light appears colored.
Mass based concentration is temperature: Electron excitation between split d orbitals.

Which concentration term is defined as t: Why is Zinc Sulfate (ZnSO4) colorless while Copper Sulfate (CuSO4) is blue
Molarity: Zn 2 plus has a fully filled d10 configuration prohibiting d d transitions
Normality: Zn 2 plus absorbs UV light which is invisible
Molality is a measure of concentration t: Zn 2 plus has a 3d10 configuration. The d orbitals are completely filled, so there are no empty slots for an electron to jump into within the d subshell. No d d transition can occur, so no visible light is absorbed. Cu 2 plus is 3d9, allowing transitions.
Mass based concentration is temperature: Full d10 shell prevents d d transitions.
Confusing volume based units like molari: Thinking it is because Zinc is a white metal.
Write the orbital diagram for Zn 2 plus.
Analyze the effect of temperature on mas: Check for the availability of the hole in the upper energy level.
